intro: Comastoma pseudopulmonarium, commonly known as the false lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-like growth habit with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
